{"step_by_step_thinking": "When the lip line is opposite the tips of the upper incisors in a patient with competent lips together at rest, it is considered to be in the average position. This means that the upper lip covers the upper incisors to a normal extent. If the lip line is higher than the tips of the upper incisors, it would be described as high. If the lip line does not cover the tips of the upper incisors, it would be described as incomplete. And if the lip line is lower than the tips of the upper incisors, it would be described as low.", "answer_choice": "A. Average"}
